message.entry: 'Interactions' value must be 'all', 'none', or a string array of these values: \n \n'rotate', 'zoom', 'pan', 'clip', 'slice', 'axes'
Set at most 6 clipping planes.
Specify parent as a valid Viewer object.
Reparenting object is not supported.
Specify planes as a 1-by-4 vector where the first 3 elements are a unit vector.

Viewer children must be objects of the following type: 
 
images.ui.graphics.Image
images.ui.graphics.Volume
images.ui.graphics.BlockedVolume
images.ui.graphics.Surface
'CurrentObject' must be a child of the Viewer object.
Interactive drawing requires at least one visible object in the Viewer.
'ClippingInteractions' must be 'all', 'none', or a string array of these values: \n \n'add', 'remove', 'rotate', 'translate'
'SliceInteractions' must be 'all', 'none', or a string array of these values: \n \n'add', 'remove', 'rotate', 'translate'
'CropInteractions' must be 'all', 'none', or a string array of these values: \n \n'add', 'remove', 'move'
3-D rendering is not supported in figures created with the figure function. Use uifigure to create a supported figure for 3-D rendering.
An orthographic camera is required to view the scale bar.
'CameraPosition' must not match the values of 'CameraTarget'.
'CurrentMode' must be a valid object in the Mode property.
Set at most 10 lights.
Specify box as a 2-by-3 matrix where the first and second rows correspond to minimum and maximum values of the box, respectively.
Specify sphere as a 1-by-4 matrix where the first three elements correspond to the center and the fourth element corresponds to a non-negative radius respectively.

Specify cylinder as a 1-by-5 matrix the first three elements correspond to the center, the fourth element corresponds to a non-negative radius and the fifth element corresponds to a non-negative height respectively.
Specified 'Parent' already contains a Viewer object. To render additional objects in the same scene, specify 'Parent' as a handle to the existing Viewer object.
CropRegion must be specified as an empty array or an array with dimensions (2,3), (1,4) or (1,5).
Viewer requires a valid Image Processing Toolbox license.
In order to use the Viewer, you must have Image Processing Toolbox installed.

The graphics card on this machine encountered an issue during rendering. Consider freeing up graphics resources on this machine, downsampling your data, or creating multilevel blockedImages to display large data.
The graphics card on this machine does not meet the minimum requirements for visualization.
Viewer encountered an error during rendering: {0}
Insufficient memory for visualization. Viewer will attempt to render a downsampled version of the scene. Consider creating multilevel blockedImages to display large data.
The graphics card on this machine encountered an issue during rendering and the rendering could not be recovered.
Hardware accelerated graphics support is required for this 3-D visualization.
Surface must be a 3-D triangulation object or a 3-D logical array.
Triangulation object must contain 3-D data.
Mask must be a 3-D logical array with no singleton dimensions.
Points must be an M-by-3 array of (x, y, z) locations.
Line segments must be separated by a complete row of NaN values.
Text position must be specified as a 1-by-3 array for world coordinates or as a 1-by-2 array for normalized screen coordinates.
Caliper distances must not exceed the distance between the endpoints specified by the Position property.
Viewer contains more than one image. Specify the image handle as an input to resolve ambiguity.
Viewer does not contain a valid image.
Image object must be valid.
Overlay
Intensity
Row
Column
Color
The property {0} is not supported on the Volume object. Set the {1} property on the Volume object's parent Viewer.
The property {0} is no longer supported with volume rendering.
The property {0} is no longer supported. Use the {1} property.
The function setVolume is no longer supported. Use the 'Data' property to update the volume.
{0} has been removed. With appropriate code changes, use 'volshow' instead.
